results.title: Sound in View (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Technology”.
A visual depiction of sound waves including digital and modulated formats. The aim of this program is to teach the meanings of a number of terms used to describe the signals used in telecommunications.

results.title: SOS
results.brief_description: Comical but scathing indictment of man’s age-old exploitation of women, presented via the historical theories of a mad professor who is convinced that women are temporary visitors from a far-away galaxy. Starring Maurizio Nichetti as the teacher. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sorry
results.brief_description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.

results.title: Sonny Terry: shoutin' the blues
results.brief_description: Blind blues musician, Sonny Terry, performs a highly innovative piece on the harmonica. Filmed and recorded at the Broadway Motel, Oakland, California in 1969. (A useful compliment to ‘Chicago Blues’ title code: 507696)

results.title: Sonata in Brussels
results.brief_description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.

results.title: Somewhere in France: in search of the ANZACS
results.brief_description: Designed to help students become more aware of the history around them, this video and guide provides students with an excellent primary source kit of Australian experiences of the Great War; as told through the experiences of Australian soldiers.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of youth unemployment and how it affects job seekers. Uses a humorous approach to present the case of a young man who loses his job and the problems he faces when he tries to find another. Cast includes: David Bradley, Lachlin Miles, Dave Taggart, Pina Marino, Rossi Webb, Ingrid Buxton. Music: Milton Trot and Bill Menz.
